ratings.comment: Dr. Lenertz is an incredibly boring lecturer. She just reads off of things she wrote in a monotone voice, and her slides contain very little actual information. She jumps around between topics and does not highlight important information.

Dr. Lenertz is an okay lecturer, kind of disorganized but the best out of the 4 professors that taught this class. Tests were generally challenging, but attending office hours and reading through passages in the text helped.
I liked her lectures. she explained concepts clearly. her test could be hard, but everyone got extra credit due to a hard exam.

While the lectures alone don't provide enough information to get an A, her online notes for each lecture are fantastic! This section of biochem was my best because she clearly laid out everything we were expected to know in her online notesR.

Lisa teaches the synthesis unit of Biochem 501 . While it can be intimidating to know that you're required to memorize the MANY pathways covered in her section, she does a nice job emphasizing the steps/enzymes she expects you to know. Her unit was certainly tough, but the exam was very fair! She is a very nice individual, but her lectures are dry.

Of the four sections of the course and four professors teaching this teacher got the hardest section to teach but did not teach it well.  Too much information was provided and the lecture slides are composed of endless pathways.  Test was too specific in my opinion.  Shes good at answering your questions and will point you in the right direction.
She is a terrible public speaker.
Terribly organized lectures and teaching habits.
She seems nice enough, but her lectures are extremely dull and terribly organized.  Powerpoints and lecture notes make no sense and are a complete mess.

This is a tough class, there are 4 professors that teach this course, Lisa is in charge of the class.  If you have any questions she is very happy to help, which is wonderful.  But as a lecturer she is boring.  She makes a weird sound while she talks, which can get very annoying.  You can tell she wants to do well, but maybe doesn't have it.

Professor Lenertz has a clear grasp of the material and eager to help students during office hours. Though the class covers a lot of content, she clearly emphasizes the important material and poses helpful questions.  She was the primary lecturer for two sections of the course and a discussion leader for every section. DISCUSSION SECTIONS ARE GREAT

Lisa is kind of dry as a lecturer, and sometimes the lectures were a little awkward, but she really tries hard and clearly loves teaching. Her exams are very fair and she really seems to want her students to succeed. Study the power points; exam questions come almost word for word off of them. Her sections were the most interesting of 501.

Since she's the head of the Biochem 501 lectures, she knows what to know to do well. She's really helpful through email and office hours. She also does a really good job of having extra time at the end to give review problems and highlight what is important for the exams.
Very unclear... Does not explain things well. Hard to follow. Boring.

Lisa is not the best teacher, but at least she tries. She tells you what to expect on the exam. Because materials in her sections are the hardest, attending lectures, going to optional discussion, and doing review sheets are recommended.
Great lecturer. Be prepared to record lectures and re-listen to them in order to get good grades on exams. Exams test basic concepts DIRECTLY FROM LECTURE. Great professor and mentor.

Lisa's unit was the best taught unit in biochem 501. Her section is the most organized and she clearly lays out exactly what you should know. Basically, if you know the individual pathways and each steps and know everything in the problem set, you will do great on her test!

Lisa was one of the coolest teachers I've had. She has a good sense of humor and sarcasm that she uses to make class more lively. Although her test was extremely tough, she explained things pretty well and was very engaging. I would take her again.
She definitely could work on the clarity of her lectures, but she truly does care about her students and was a great person to work with.

Very interested in helping her students. She runs an optional discussion and provides additional problems that are very similar to the exam questions. Her lectures are a bit unorganized at times, and sometimes hard to follow, but she is a straight-shooter and tells you what is important for exams.
Do not take Lisa Lenertz
Her lectures make the material much harder to learn. AVIOD HER

She tries to explain the material but she just isn't very good at it. She contradicts herself a lot and ends up confusing everyone more than they already were. The class requires a ton of memorization.
She seems to know the materials; however, it was hard to follow up with her explanation. Lecture that she gives is unclear and hard to understand.
She is not very clear seems to know the material but cant explain it very clearly
